concise_definition: n. 一份（食物）, 服务, 服役; v. 提供, 服务, 服役

definitions.explanation_en: A portion of food or drink prepared and presented for one person to consume at one time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为一人一次食用而准备和提供的食物或饮料的分量。
definitions.example_en: One serving of this soup contains 200 calories.
definitions.example_cn: 一份这种汤含有200卡路里。

definitions.explanation_en: The act of providing food, drink, or assistance to someone, especially in a professional or formal context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在专业或正式场合中为他人提供食物、饮料或帮助的行为。
definitions.example_en: The waiter took our order and began serving the appetizers.
definitions.example_cn: 服务员记下我们的点单，开始上开胃菜。

definitions.explanation_en: A period of time during which someone performs duties, especially in the military, government, or an organization.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某人在军队、政府或组织中履行职责的一段时间。
definitions.example_en: He completed three years of active serving in the navy before retiring.
definitions.example_cn: 他在退役前完成了三年的现役服役。

definitions.explanation_en: To provide food or drink to someone, typically in a restaurant, home, or formal setting.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在餐厅、家庭或正式场合中为他人提供食物或饮料。
definitions.example_en: The chef served the steak with a side of roasted vegetables.
definitions.example_cn: 主厨将牛排配以烤蔬菜上桌。

definitions.explanation_en: To fulfill a role or function, especially in an official or public capacity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指担任某种角色或履行某种职能，尤指在官方或公共事务中。
definitions.example_en: She serves on the city council as a representative of the downtown district.
definitions.example_cn: 她作为市中心区的代表担任市议会议员。

definitions.explanation_en: To be useful or appropriate for a particular purpose or person.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指适合或能满足某种特定目的或某人的需求。
definitions.example_en: This chair serves well as a reading nook.
definitions.example_cn: 这把椅子很适合作为阅读角。

comparison.analysis: “Portion”（份量）是一个中性词，仅指食物或物质的定量部分，不涉及提供或服务的动作。而 “serving” 不仅指分量，还隐含了‘被提供’或‘被分配’的语境，常用于营养标签或餐饮服务场景。
“Service”（服务）是抽象名词，泛指为他人提供帮助或完成某项工作的行为总称，涵盖范围更广（如客户服务、公共服务）。“Serving” 作为名词时更具体，常指提供食物或履行短期职责的行为，是 “service” 的一种具体表现形式。
“Dish”（菜肴）指一道具体的烹饪成品，如‘宫保鸡丁’，强调食物的种类和形式。而 “serving” 强调的是该菜肴被分发或食用的单位量，是‘一份’的呈现方式，而非食物本身。
